intro: Pentagonia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
